intro: Microula tibetica var. laevis, commonly known as the Tibetan microula, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the extreme conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
